column4: well, if the directory you copied stuff into already had files and directories, obviously they won't match
no but there are single files not even in dirs in /home/olderuser, but there are no files like this in /home/newuser
it's also missing the dirs and in fact i can't see one thing it has copied, i'm viewing from inside the gui, perhaps a restart is required?
try it again .. this time do this..    cp -avR /src /dest
aye aye, ty
before i key in that command, i just noticed the two dir match exactly in file size...
this might be better.   rsync -av /src/  /dest/
*nods*

within a second i got the output: building file list ... done * sent 90496 bytes  received 20 bytes  60344.00 bytes/sec * total size is 20032805696  speedup is 221317.84 *** but the files still aren't visible
verify using ls..   ls -l ,*
it has copied the whole olduser dir, including the dir itself, into olduser
well, is that what you wanted?
it has copied the whole olduser dir, including the dir itself, into newuser (edited this line)
no because it has placed the actual dir olduser, inside newsuer. i want olduser to *become newuser
i'm not sure what you have done there .. but why don't you just backup newuser   mv  newuser newuser.bak   and then    cp -avR  olduser  newuser
can i skip the backup of newuser, there's nothing in newuser home dir, i just reinstalled ubuntu
after i did the cp -avR olduser newuser my terminal has stopped outputting text and i get the line (arg: 3) but no command prompt
i;m not convinced you ran the command as i asked you to .. newuser was not supposed to exit, it was supposed to be renamed to newuser.bak
make sure newuser is backed up..  mv newuser  newuser.bak   and then check if it really exists .. once you have done that ..   cp -avR olduser newuser
remember, newuser should not exist prior to the cp command
is there anything wrong with me using the gui to show hidden files in olduser and jsut copying them to new user?
